description: From Dutch gijl, from gijlen (“to ferment”).

entries.meaning: The amount of beer brewed at a time.
examples: Perkins told me Yesterday that his Guile of Beer had a Summer-head on't, like as one sees in the last Weeks of Brewing in a forward Spring:—The Phænomenon surprized him I find.

entries.meaning: Fermented wort used for making vinegar.
